intro: Sideritis leptoclada, commonly known as the slender beard vetch, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in dry, sunny environments. Sideritis leptoclada is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
